result.execSummary:
The defendant Marissa N. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marissa N. Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Marissa N. Smith.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant's father appeared by phone. Per agreement, State makes global recommendation. Defendant to plead to Count 1 with State recommending WSPS 4 years (2 & 2), concurrent.

Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives her rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Felony loss of rights reviewed. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Mickelson heard and requests probation. Credit to be determined. Defendant heard. 

Court heard and orders WSPS 4-1/2 years (18 mo & 3 yr), counseling, court costs waived, follow mental health recommendations, DNA. Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration. Attorney Mickelson to notify court of credit.

Defendant Marissa N. Smith appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Marissa N. Smith.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mickelson heard and requests another status date. Attorney Michelson is hoping for a global resolution in all cases.. No comment from Attorney Pozorski. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marissa N. Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Marissa N. Smith.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Father present by phone; mother in person. Kelly Schlarmann from DSS by video. Attorney Mickelson requests continuance for global resolution and to find appropriate placement. Ms. Schlarmann heard. Court sets status conference. Either court could resolve all cases.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Marissa N. Smith in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Marissa N. Smith. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed. Defendant reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives her right to preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty. Status set. Trial weeks to be determined.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Marissa N. Smith in court, in custody at Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Marissa N. Smith.  State does not object to the findings of the competency report. Attorney Mickelson stipulates to report. Court finds defendant is competent and releases her from her stay at Mendota. Court heard on bond. Attorney Mickelson heard on bond. Attorney Riniker heard on bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond with conditions to abide by all terms of safety plan and to take all prescribed medications. Signature bond goes into effect June 24, 2022 when safety plan has been decided. Preliminary Hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
of commitment for treatment (incompetency)
cc: DHS, OCRP 4-1-22 em

Defendant Marissa N. Smith appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lisa McDougal in court for defendant. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Counsel heard. Court makes probable cause finding by stipulation of parties and finds defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency per evaluation in 22CM25. Court orders defendant to undergo outpatient treatment and OCRP. Court heard on placement. State does not request bond on new charge. Status set.
Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
